chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Pierre J. Daniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Pierre J. Daniel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Pierre J. Daniel was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Pierre J. Daniel was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Pierre J. Daniel was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not  have contact with Dajanay Y unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  
Count 1 - Total length of sentence:  24 months consecutive to any other sentence.
Initial term of confinement:  18 months WSP.  No credit for time served.
Length of extended supervision:  6 months w/conditions.
Def. is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Counts 2 and 5 - Sentences withheld, placed on probation for 3 years consecutive to Count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  Counts 1, 2 and 5 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 3 and 4 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Atty Komp requests an adjournment as DE arrived to the jail late yesterday on his writ so she hasn't had an opportunity to go over State's offer with the DE.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
